intro: Torulinium macrocephalum var. eggersii, commonly known as the Eggers' torula, is a rare and distinctive plant species characterized by its large, showy inflorescences. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
